source.840154a2:
#since position column and level column are one of the same thing we'll take only level column as our independent variable
x = ds.iloc[:,1:-1].values
y = ds.iloc[:,-1].values
print(x)
print(y)
source.3333ff3b:
#applying feature scaling
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
sc_x = StandardScaler()
x = sc_x.fit_transform(x)
sc_y = StandardScaler()
y = sc_y.fit_transform(y.reshape(-1,1))
print(x)
print(y)
source.3cd4dc33:
#training the model
from sklearn.svm import SVR
svr = SVR(kernel = 'rbf')
svr.fit(x,y.flatten())
source.0e30ab18:
**FEATURE SCALING**
* AS SUPPORT VECTOR REGRESSION HAVE AN IMPLICIT EQUATION FOR DEPENDENT VARIABLE AND INDEPENDENT VARIABLE, THEREFORE FEATURE SCALING IS NECESSARY IN SVR
* STANDARDIZATION WILL BE DONE
source.be7a9586:
A Support Vector Regression model for predicting salary of a employee according to their level, more level means higher the position of the employee and hence higher the salary.
Dataset consists of three features,first feature will be ignored because position or level is one of the same thing, hence only level feature will be taken (level is independent and salary is dependent)
kernel used in training the model is radial basis function (rbf), which is an non-linear type of kernel.
source.dc8e8e49:
**SPLITTING THE DATASET**
* as only 10 rows are present in the dataset, no splitting will be done so that we can have more data to train our model
* splitting will decrease accuracy
